data.title: [WIP] add project.resolveNonRealpath to return non-realpath compared to project.resolvePath
data.body:
This PR is trying to address #9879.

~~The first commit simply changes the semantic of `project.resolvePath()` to return a non-realpath. Since this might break the callers expectation I will try to keep the semantic of existing API on-top as outlined in https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9879#issuecomment-162253183 as necessary.~~ See newer comment for current behavior.

data.title: Atom hangs for ~30s when pasting a large text block into a new tab.
data.body:
Steps to repeat:
1. Copy a 161606-line XML document fully indented with spaces (and replete with CDATA) into the clipboard (<1s on **OS X Atom 1.5.3**)
2. Open a new tab in Atom
3. Paste
4. Atom hangs for 30 seconds.

I'm pretty sure 90% of the bugs I experience daily stem from work being done on GUI threads.

data.title: Atom crashes when loading a large .json file
data.body: When I load a dumped json it freezes instantly and I have to terminate it. With some json files I will have more luck and will be able to load them after a crash and keep on working, but with others it just won't and will crash inmediately after opening. I am on a Debian machine with plenty of hardware resources.

data.title: community packages not showing
data.body:
First, take a look at this:

![screen shot 2016-02-16 at 11 14 22 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2006175/13098876/0d081bb0-d503-11e5-86f0-6717bfe59a6b.png)

It states that I have 29 community packages installed but I can see only 1.

Atom version : 1.5.3
Mac OS X El Capitan

data.title: Command-tilde no longer cycles through open windows
data.body:
On `master` (41161dd462a1be9073752a34b4809612f933da6e).

This is a regression, presumably introduced by https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/9627.

/cc @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: Registry for TextEditors
data.body:
Currently, only `TextEditors` that are items of `Panes` are observable.
From the model point-of-view, the `TextEditors` are linked to the workspace through the `PaneContainer` and `Panes`.

There are other `TextEditors` that are of interest though.
For example, the editor in `find-and-replace` might want autocomplete functionality (atom/autocomplete-plus#383).

With this change, any editor created through `workspace.buildTextEditor` can be observed, which seemed the cleanest way to observe `TextEditors` across a varied use in the model.

Note: the tests seem to succeed locally, let me know if they are failing due to flakiness or if I am doing something wrong.

data.title: [WIP] Optimize package loading at startup
unsaved buffers can't be found with buffer finder
data.body:
Cannot switch to unsaved buffers from the buffer finder. The only way to select an unsaved buffer is to click on its tab.

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. Open existing file
2. Create a new file
3. Switch back to existing file
4. Try to use buffer finder to switch back the unsaved buffer

**Expected behavior:**

Unsaved buffers are selectable from the buffer finder

**Observed behavior:**

Neither the list of buffers or Ctrl+B, Return (i.e. toggle two most recently used tabs) are able to select any unsaved buffers

**Atom version:** 1.6.0-beta3
**OS and version:** Ubuntu 15.10

**Installed packages:**


data.title: Add core setting for pending tabs configuration
data.body: Fixes https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10762

data.title: Recent documents menu grows without end
data.body:
The new "Recent documents menu" in the dock provided by #9606 seems to grow without end, some of them multiple times, ignoring my system setting to never show these menus at all. This is troublesome for me as I normally have forty or more files open at once across a half dozen projects or so:

![screen shot 2016-02-16 at 14 15 55](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/881572/13092981/9bdcdbb0-d4b7-11e5-9fab-347c31f3b28d.png)

(Running Atom 1.5.3 on Mac OS X 10.11.)

data.title: Add the -a, --add CLI option
data.body:
This commit adds the `-a, --add` option to the CLI which allows users to add paths to the last focused window (similar to Sublime), like shown here:

![add-option](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/228886/13084046/9380e642-d4cf-11e5-902a-cd1e126685fd.gif)

This allows you to open many projects in the same Atom window (but not necessarily at the same time) without the hassle of clicking through the menus (right click > Add Project Folder > find my way to the folder...) but doing it from the CLI instead.

This comes with:
- a single additional test, I'm not sure if adding more is necessary
- documented CLI usage (automated)

I'm not sure if that feature needs to be documented elsewhere, if it does I'd be happy to do it.

data.title: Flaky TextEditorPresenter spec
data.body:
See https://travis-ci.org/atom/atom/jobs/109626270.

Similar to https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/10435.

data.title: Add PackageManager::hasLoadedInitialPackages API
data.body: Currently there is no way to get the current state of package loading, we do have a `onDidLoadInitialPackages` but it's unreliable as it won't be triggered unless your package is activated on boot

data.title: Log output for core specs
data.body: Fixes #10837.

data.title: Core specs task sometimes time out on Travis
data.body:
Travis times out builds if they haven't had any output in 10 minutes. Our core specs currently take right around 10 minutes and they don't log any output. So it's pretty hit-or-miss as to whether our core specs complete or get timed out.

We should just pass through the output of the core specs to stdout so that Travis knows its still running.

data.title: Keymapping for moving changing selection is windows-oriented only
data.body: When inside a line, the succession of ⇧⌘→ and ⇧⌘← moves the selection starting from the original caret position. This is not what OS X users are accustomed to, see Xcode: --- I’m actually unsure if Atom should change behavior. Looks like it’s something only OS X oriented editors actually do.

data.title: Add TextEditor.prototype.cursorsForScreenRowRange
data.body:
With this PR, `TextEditorPresenter` can avoid to scan through all the cursors to understand whether they're visible on screen. This dramatically reduces the calls to `getScreenRange` and, thus, makes `updateCursorsState` faster for scenarios where the number of cursors is elevated (e.g. editing, scrolling through a file, etc.).

Although this code path will partially, and positively, be affected by the in-progress `DisplayLayer` redesign, I believe that reducing the number of cursors we need to iterate is still valuable in terms of performance and reduces the number of `getEnd()` queries we need to perform against `MarkerIndex`.
#### Before

![screen shot 2016-02-16 at 14 44 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/13077922/29de3748-d4bc-11e5-9137-8dfb5d2be0f9.png)

_(Total: `~ 1183ms`, benchmarks performed by editing 3000 lines, writing 5 letters)_
#### After

![screen shot 2016-02-16 at 14 46 45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/13077986/9dd66d82-d4bc-11e5-9cb5-9998620adc47.png)

_(Total: `~ 98ms`, 12x faster :racehorse:)_

/cc: @nathansobo @maxbrunsfeld

data.title: Uncaught Error

1. use sshfs to mount a drive on a remote machine `sshfs -p 20022 local-petefoth@xxx.yyy.zzz.aaa:/ ~/wikitest/
2. Browse to a directory on the mounted drive in Finder

data.title: How to specify the atom-build location to script/grunt install
data.body:
Hi,

I am writing a spec file to build Atom with the Open Build Service and what I need to know is how to specify the atom-build directory (i.e., the directory, that is, by default `/tmp/atom-build`) to `sudo script/grunt install`? Is this, per chance, the `--build-dir` mentioned in the [Linux build instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md)?

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Multiple configurations
data.body: Is it possible to have multiple configurations for atom? Right now I have installed Atom Beta through the installer and the standalone version of Atom stable. I would like to have different configurations for the two. Is that possible somehow?

data.title: Atom tree-view git highlighting isn't always being refreshed in realtime on OSX
data.body:
Green (added) and orange (modified) colors sometimes remain until I exit from full screen mode, switch desktops or click on the items  in the tree-view. This is pretty annoying and misleading.

```
Atom Version: 1.5.3
OS X version: 10.11.3
```

data.title: Graphical issues have been occuring ever since 1.2.0
data.body:
![screenshot from 2016-02-15 22-25-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3903329/13066392/556e9e5e-d433-11e5-8331-aa39be52b3ea.png)

I'm on Gentoo Linux, running Gnome 3.18 with the Nvidia binary driver v361.28.  

Ever since Atom 1.2.0, I have been experiencing these graphical issues as shown above and it happens all over the window, not just in the text editor.  I have tried compiling Atom from source, but it has the same issues.  I suspect it might have something to do with the version of Webkit Atom is using because I noticed Spotify 1.0.19 has the same kind of graphical glitches.

Atom 1.1.0 is the latest version I can run without these issues occurring.

data.title: Fix another TextEditorPresenter spec race
data.body: Add the decoration after subscribing to state updates. Same fix as #10792.

data.title: Port repository subdirectory status fixes to async repo
data.body: Bring the fixes over from https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10758 and https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10797.
